name: Lab
longDesc: This seems to be some sort of laboratory or research area.  There is some device here that is surrounded by lab equipment.
shortDesc: A laboratory of sorts.  There are tables with plant samples arrayed on the sides..
feat1desc: A clipboard with various notes about some research subject.
feat1interactOptions: read, investigate, study, glance, flip through, look through
feat1interactSuccess: You look through the notes.  They talk about testing the dosage of scopalamine upon different subjects.  Studies have shown that relatively high doses were needed for some people, and that additional medications such as benzodiazepines were added to counteract some of the side effects.  Subjects without the additives showed excessive anxiety and were prone to seizures.  The subjects with them have been functional and show signs of enhanced intelligence and spontaneous creativity/insights but seem prone to develop a dissociative fugue...
feat1interactComplete: You read through the notes again but find nothing new.  You feel some faint pity for these subjects.  Sounds like a rough experience.
feat1interactFail: You are unable to read through the notes.
feat2desc: This device seems to be a puzzle of sorts.  There are three dispensers of fluids.  When placed in a beaker
feat2interactSuccess: You begin tinkering with the puzzle.
feat2interactComplete: The puzzle has already been solved.  The drawer should be unlocked now.
feat2interactFail: You are unable to work on the puzzle.
feat3desc: This is a locked drawer.  The lock seems to be connected to the device.
feat3interactSuccess: You open the drawer.  Inside there is a keycard
feat4desc: These notes seem to be about a group of subjects known as alpha.
feat4interactSuccess: You glance through the summary of the last page.  Alpha group did not respond at all to the treatment, but after incrementing the dosage to nearly ten times the original amount, the subjects became far more passive and tractable.  However, they seemed unable to retain new memories and were prone to heightened anxiety and seizures.  Subjects seemed to develop a cognative dissonance, nearing apathy, where information concerning their own situation was concerned.  It seems that these subjects are functional but seem no longer seem to be aware, or do not care, that they are participating in an experiment, even when told so.
feat4interactComplete: You look through the notes but there doesn't seem to be anything new.  Wonder what happened to these subjects...
feat4interactFail: You are unable to read through the notes on the alpha group.
feat5desc: These notes seem to be about a group of subjects known as beta.
feat5interactSuccess: You glance through the notes.  After the failure of the alpha group, subject group beta was administered a similar amount of medication along with benzodiazepines, opioid analgesics, dopamine agonists and antihistimines.  The resulting treatment proved effective in creating mostly tractable subjects but their recollection was severely impacted, as well as inexplicably causing severe incontinence and diarrhea.  Moderating the mixture may be necessary to reduce adverse side effects.  This mixture has shown to be useful as the information gained during the test seems to be lost as the treatment wears off, allowing for re-use of the subjects after a period of detoxification and restoration to baseline physical health levels.
feat5interactComplete: You look through the notes but there doesn't seem to be anything new.  Sounds like these subjects had it rough.
feat5interactFail: You are unable to read through the notes on the beta group.
feat6desc: These notes seem to be about a group of subjects known as gamma.
feat6interactSuccess: You glance through the notes.  Adjustments were made from the results of beta group and we have determined that this is a near-optimal composition.  Individualized tests have become necessary in order to study the efficacy of different quantities of each component.  It is our belief that by putting the subject in an optimal situation to follow through with a suggestion, then they will carry through and allow us to observe their actions in a much more natural setting.  The treatment seems to wear off after about two weeks, allowing us to retrieve the given subject and run the experiment again.
feat6interactComplete: You look through the notes but there doesn't seem to be anything new.  Wonder why they have all these notes on test subjects anways...
feat6interactFail: You are unable to read through the notes on the gamma group.
